article.headline: UC Davis 93, Cal State Northridge 88 2OT
article.story: DAVIS, Calif. (AP) -- Sophomore Vince Oliver had 30 points and six rebounds to help UC Davis beat Cal State Northridge 93-88 in double-overtime on Thursday night. Rommel Marentez and Kyle Brucculeri had 14 points each for the Aggies (4-12). The Matadors (9-8), who lost to the Aggies for the first time in five meetings, got 19 points from Jonathan Heard and 16 from Calvin Chitwood. Northridge erased a five-point deficit to get within one after Terrell Jones' three-point play made the score 89-88 with 22.8 seconds left in the second overtime. When the Matadors resorted to desperation fouls, Rommel Marentez and Ari Warmerdam hit two free throws each in the last 17.8 seconds to seal the victory for the Aggies. Tied at 67, Thomas Juillerat missed a free throw with 12.4 seconds left in regulation that would have gave UC Davis the lead. Matadors took possession, but the Aggies' defense prevented point guard Tre Peters from getting a shot off as time expired to send the game into overtime. With 3.3 seconds left in the first overtime, Jones made one of two free throws to tie the score at 77 with 3.3 seconds left. Juillerat's barely missed a soft hook shot at the buzzer for UC Davis. Shane Hanson hit two free throws to finally put the Aggies on the board with 12:27 left in the first half, as UC Davis missed its first eight shots from the field. The Aggies bounced back and took a 32-27 halftime lead. UC Davis hit 11 of their last 18 shots, after missing 9 of their first 10 from the floor in the first half.

statistics.name: points
statistics.description: The number of points scored.

statistics.name: fieldGoals
statistics.description: Field Goal makes and attempts.

statistics.name: freeThrows
statistics.description: Free Throw makes and attempts.

statistics.name: assists
statistics.description: The number of times a player who passes the ball to a teammate in a way that leads to a score by field goal, meaning that he or she was "assisting" in the basket. There is some judgment involved in deciding whether a passer should be credited with an assist.

statistics.name: turnovers
statistics.description: The number of times a player loses possession to the other team.

statistics.description: The total number of minutes played.

statistics.description: The average number of assists a player or team records per turnover
